iaik.pkcs.pkcs1

Class PKCS1v15Padding

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.pkcs.pkcs1.Padding
      • iaik.pkcs.pkcs1.PKCS1v15Padding

  • public final class PKCS1v15Padding
extends Padding
    PKCS#1v1.5 padding.
    This class implements the PKCS#1v1.5 padding scheme as used by the PKCS#1/ RSAES-PKCS1-v_1 encryption and RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 signature algorithms.
    Version:
    File Revision 13

    • Constructor Detail

      • PKCS1v15Padding

        public PKCS1v15Padding(java.lang.String paddingName,
               java.lang.String transformationMode)
                throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        Creates a PKCS#1v1.5 Padding object with given padding name and transformationMode.

        The transformationMode is the "mode" specification of the transformation string that has to be specified when instantiating a Cipher object. For RSA Ciphers that use PKCS#1v1.5 padding the mode name may be "ECB", "NONE" or the blockType number (0, 1, or 2), e.g.: 

         Cipher.getInstance("RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding");
        or 
         Cipher.getInstance("RSA/bt/PKCS1Padding");
        where bt is 0, 1 or 2.
        If "ECB" or "NONE" is specified as transformation mode, the blockType will be automatically selected as 2 for public key encryption/ private key decryption and 1 for private key encryption/ public key decryption.
        Parameters:
        paddingName - the name of the padding scheme ("PKCS1Padding" or "PKCS1PaddingSSL2")
        transformationMode - the transformation mode name ("ECB", "NONE" or "0", "1" or "2")
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - if the transformationMode is not "ECB" or "NONE" but specifies an illegal block type

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(int paddingMode,
        java.security.Key key,
        int modLen,
        java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec params,
        java.security.SecureRandom random)
          throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                 java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Initializes this Padding engine.
        Overrides:
        init in class Padding
        Parameters:
        paddingMode - the padding mode, either PAD_MODE (1) or UNPAD_MODE (2)
        key - the RSA en/decryption key; used for checking block type conformance
        modLen - the length of the key modulus
        params - parameters; ignored since not required for PKCS#1v1.5 padding
        random - generator supplying random numbers if required
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key does not match to the padding block type
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the parameters are invalid, or the padding Mode is invalid (not PAD_MODE (1) or UNPAD_MODE (2), or SSL2 padding variant is requested in UNPAD mode which is not supported

      • getParameters

        public java.security.AlgorithmParameters getParameters()
        Returns null since no parameters are used.

        getParameters in class Padding

        public byte[] pad(byte[] data)
           throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Pads the supplied data according to PKCS#1v1.5.
        Specified by:
        pad in class Padding
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the padded data
        Throws:

      • unpad

        public byte[] unpad(byte[] paddedData)
             throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Unpads the supplied padded data according to PKCS#1v1.5. The contents of the paddedData input array maybe changed after calling this method.
        Specified by:
        unpad in class Padding
        Parameters:
        paddedData - the data to be unpadded;
        Returns:
        the unpadded data
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding was invalid
